intro: Henckelia densifolia, commonly known as the dense-leaved henckelia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dense, leathery foliage and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
